item.title: Optimize dating for non-interference with platonic relationships
item.description: [content warning—I make a lot of claims that certain ways of hitting on people are much better than other ways. If you have a tendency to freak out about whether you’re a terrible person for being sexually attracted to people, maybe don’t read this.]

item.title: Flinching away from hard things
item.description: I have a strong reflex to not do complicated things when I’m writing code—I flinch away and try really hard to avoid them. I think this reflex often serves me well, because complicated code is a pain to maintain and in real life you usually don’t need it. When I watch other people code, I often see them start down a complicated path to solve a problem, and then persevere through it. When faced with the same problems as them, I’m much more inclined to start down a complicated path, then realize it’s going to be complicated and reflexively give up. Most problems that I run across actually have relatively simple solutions, so this serves me well: I end up flailing for longer at the start, but then I end up with simpler code than I would have had otherwise.

item.title: Hyperactive Record
item.description: Here is a fun open source project which someone should build! I’ve written a readme and put it on Github but I don’t think I have the time to actually build this. I present it here in the hope that one of you might decide that you like it and want to build it!

item.title: Data structure projects
item.description: Here are some ideas for fun projects with data structures! I get really excited about data structures and if you want to ask me for clarification of any of these I’m super super happy to talk to you about them!

item.title: Optimize for fun when you're trying to learn
item.description: When people ask me what they should learn to get better at something–playing piano, programming, doing math–they want me to tell them a particular skill which they should focus on.

item.title: Bleg for intro to web architecture
item.description: I want a good resource for learning about general concepts in web application architecture? Most of the content would be grouped by application layer. So the main sections would be like: data persistence, application servers, caching layers…
